articles.title: Pyongyang Mass Rally Marks Day of Anti-U.S Struggle
articles.content:
Pyongyang Mass Rally Marks Day of Anti-U.S Struggle
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- A mass rally of Pyongyangites took place at Kim Il Sung Square on June 25, the day of struggle against U.S. imperialism.
					 Attending it were Kim Ki Nam, Ri Su Yong and other senior party and state officials, the chairman of the C.C., Korean Social Democratic Party amd officials of ministries and national institutions, industrial establishments, co-op farms and universities in the city, working people, youth and students and overseas Koreans on a visit to the homeland and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 Present there on invitation were representatives and staff members of foreign embassies and members of the military attaches corps here and other foreign guests.
					
					 Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, and delegates from the working class, agricultural workers and youth and students took the floor at the rally.
					
					 They referred to the facts that the U.S. imperialists ignited a war against the DPRK on June 25, 1950, resorted to all kinds of the cruelest methods and means to commit an unheard-of holocaust and vandalism, made wholesale use of germ and chemical weapons prohibited by international law, and even ran amuck to use an A-bomb to exterminate the Korean people.
					
					 The thrice-cursed atrocities against the Korean people committed by the U.S. imperialist beasts were recorded in history as scars never to be healed, they said, adding:
					
					 The hostile forces led by the U.S. imperialists have cooked up a series of "sanctions resolutions" against the DPRK and frantically staged the drills for a nuclear war against it. This is an unpardonable provocation and frontal challenge to the DPRK's idea, system, army and people.
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists and puppet war maniacs ignite a nuclear war on this land, the Korean army and people will annihilate all the invaders by dint of the single-minded unity, invincible military forces, incredible self-reliance and self-development, and surely achieve the historic cause of national reunification.
					
					 Then followed a public procession.
					
					 Meanwhile, similar mass rallies were held in every province to mark the day of struggle against U.S. imperialism.

articles.title: Int'l Meeting on Peace and Stability of Korean Peninsula Held
articles.content:
Int'l Meeting on Peace and Stability of Korean Peninsula Held
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- An international meeting on peace and stability of the Korean peninsula took place in Madrid on Friday under the sponsorship of the Elcano Royal Institute of International and Strategic Studies.
					 Present there were a delegation of the Institute for Disarmament and Peace of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK and delegations from policy-studying institutions of Spain, France, Germany, the UK, Italy, Russia, Poland, China, the U.S. and south Korea.
					
					 There were in-depth exchanges of views on the cause of increasing tensions on the Korean peninsula and the ways of tackling the issue of the peninsula.
					
					 The DPRK side stressed at the meeting that the root cause of the tensions running high on the peninsula lies in the U.S. hostile policy and threat to ignite a nuclear war.

articles.title: Greetings to C.C., Mozambique Liberation Front Party
articles.content:
Greetings to C.C., Mozambique Liberation Front Party
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) sent a congratulatory message to the Central Committee of the Mozambique Liberation Front Party (MLFP) on Saturday on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of its founding.
					 Over the past 55 years after its birth, the MLFP has won the independence of the country through arduous struggle and registered great successes in the work to defend the sovereignty of the nation and achieve the political stability and socio-economic development of the country, the message said.
					
					 It noted the WPK is pleased over the friendly and cooperative relations with the MLFP which have excellent traditions and are growing stronger in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 Expressing belief that the relations between the two parties would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished the MLFP bigger success in its activities for the independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Pakistani Prime Minister
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Pakistani Prime Minister
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju in a message on Saturday expressed sympathy to Mian Mohammad Nawaz Sharif, prime minister of Pakistan, over a series of terrorist attacks that caused heavy casualties.
					 Reaffirming the consistent stand of the DPRK government against all sorts of terrorism, the message wished the Pakistani government successes in its efforts to stamp out terrorism and ensure the social stability.

articles.title: Ri Yong Ho Greets FM of Slovenia
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho Greets FM of Slovenia
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho Sunday sent a message of greeting to Karl Erjavec, deputy prime minister and minister of Foreign Affairs of Slovenia, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would grow stronger in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Delegation of Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation Leaves
Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation led by Director Jin Xian left here Sunday.

articles.title: Over 80 Myriads of Explosives Removed in DPRK
articles.content:
Over 80 Myriads of Explosives Removed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- It has been 67 years since the U.S. imperialists provoked a war of aggression against the young DPRK, but unexploded American-made bombs and shells are still defected across the country, disclosing the barbarous atrocities committed by the U.S. imperialists.
					 In the last 60-odd years since wartime, over 800,000 pieces of explosives have been removed in different parts of the DPRK.
					
					 In the new century alone, more than 200,000 explosives were detected and removed throughout the country.
					
					 At least 58,000 mines were removed during the project to acquiring hundreds hectares of new land and reclaiming over 1,000 hectares of tideland in the Yonbaek area of South Hwanghae Province and over 2,800 explosives along railway beds in Unjon County, North Phyongan Province. And tens of thousands of explosives were taken away in South Phyongan Province.
					
					 In September 2010, an air bomb weighing one ton was found five meters deep in the Taedong River surrounding Rungna Islet in Pyongyang.
					
					 The Pyongyang City People's Security Bureau removed more than 70 bombs in the construction sites of the Munsu Water Park and Mirim Riding Club in 2012 and six 250-kg bombs and over 900 shells in the construction site of Mirae Scientists Street in 2014.
					
					 Explosive removers from each provincial people's security bureau took away at least 37,000 explosives, including three 500-kg bombs during the construction of the livestock farming base in the Sepho area.
					
					 This year witnessed more than 760 explosives removed, including eight 500-kg bombs and ten 250-kg bombs, in Kumgang and Kosong counties of Kangwon Province.
					
					 Up to now, at least 350,000 butterfly bombs, including 5,800 matrix bombs, were detected, which discloses that the U.S imperialists are the unethical criminals and devils in human shape.
					
					 Few years ago, after seeing butterfly bombs detected in the construction site of the Wisong Scientists Residential District, some Western European members of the NGOs were astonished at the fact that such evil bombs were dropped en masse by the U.S. imperialists over 60 years ago.
					
					 The continuous detection of U.S.-made explosives proves that the U.S. imperialists are, indeed, bloodthirsty felons and wreckers of peace.

articles.title: Central Class Education House Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Central Class Education House Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Many servicepersons and citizens are now visiting the Central Class Education House here.
					 More than 267,000 people from over 5,900 units have visited the house since it was newly built as a center for anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. class education one year ago.
					
					 In the house more than 1,670 photos, 100-odd fine art works including semi-panoramic pictures, wax replicas and sculptures and 3,000 relics and pieces of evidence are on display to disclose the aggressive and exploitative nature of the U.S. and Japanese imperialists and class enemies.
					
					 Its visitors came to keenly realize that the U.S. imperialists are the primary enemy of the Korean people.
					
					 Through the visit they also renewed their will to mercilessly punish all sorts of enemies.

articles.title: Newspapers Call for Foiling U.S. Imperialists' Nuclear War Racket against DPRK
articles.content:
Newspapers Call for Foiling U.S. Imperialists' Nuclear War Racket against DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK's leading newspapers Sunday carry editorials on the lapse of 67 years since the Korean War ignited by the U.S. imperialists on the Korean peninsula.
					 The Korean War was a war of aggression provoked by the U.S. imperialists to stifle the DPRK by force of arms out of its wild ambition for dominating Asia and the world, and a holocaust in which they massacred countless Koreans in the most brutal and barbarous way, the papers say, adding:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists provoked a war by egging their puppet Syngman Rhee clique on. They ran wild to nip the young DPRK in its bud by hurling more than two million troops including their forces, mercenaries from its 15 satellite countries, the south Korean puppet army and Japanese militarists, and huge war hardware into the war.
					
					 But they could never subdue the Korean people.
					
					 In the 3-year hard-fought war, the Korean army and people defeated the U.S. imperialist aggressors by giving full play to their matchless bravery and popular heroism. They thus honorably defended the freedom and independence of their country and demonstrated the dignity and spirit of the nation to the world.
					
					 Noting that it has been long since the war ended on the Korean peninsula but lasting peace has not yet settled on this land, Rodong Sinmun says:
					
					 Far from drawing a lesson from their ignominious defeat in the past Korean War, the U.S. has worked hard to provoke another war century after century, not dropping its wild ambition for invasion of the DPRK.
					
					 The present south Korean authorities have turned their face away from the DPRK's call for ushering in a new history of improved north-south relations and independent reunification in the idea of By Our Nation Itself. They are only getting hell-bent on boosting "alliance" with the U.S., slapping sanctions against the DPRK and staging drills for a nuclear war against it, while hyping "nuclear threat from the north", just like the former conservative regime.
					
					 The situation calls on all compatriots at home and abroad to turn out in the nationwide struggle for achieving the country's peace and reunification by foiling the moves of the bellicose forces within and without to ignite a war again.
					
					 Minju Joson also appeals to all the compatriots in the north and the south and abroad to turn out as one in the nationwide struggle for driving the U.S. imperialists out of south Korea, preserving peace on the Korean peninsula and opening up a broad avenue to independent reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Unreasonable Behavior under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Unreasonable Behavior under Fire
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- An article of Rodong Sinmun Sunday criticizes the present south Korean regime for unreasonably putting up the solution to the nuclear issue as a precondition for repairing the north-south relations.
					 The article says:
					
					 The south Korean regime, in disregard of how the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula was spawned and why it still remains unsettled, the most essential issue, has gone so foolish as to follow the U.S. in stifling the DPRK under the pretext of the nuclear issue.
					
					 The nuclear issue is just a product of the U.S. hostile policy and nuclear threats to the DPRK.
					
					 The rulers of south Korea are also to blame for causing the nuclear issue in collusion with the U.S. and disturbing its settlement.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are trumpeting about "dismantlement of nukes" in disregard of this fact. It is just an act of treachery that follows in the footsteps of the conservative group which threw the north-south ties into nadir.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities truly hope for peace, they should take issue with the U.S. moves of bringing the disaster of nuclear war to the Korean nation while constantly posing nuclear threat to the compatriots in the north.
					
					 If they don't pursue confrontation with the DPRK, there is no need for them to worry about its self-defensive nuclear deterrent for coping with the U.S. threats of aggression.
					
					 It is just a daydream for them to get the nuclear issue settled between the north and the south as it is just an issue between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should make a U-turn in their policy to frustrate the outsiders' aggression and interference against reunification by pooling efforts with the compatriots in the north, not calling for "north's dismantlement of nukes."

articles.title: Papers Slam U.S. Moves for Provoking Nuclear War against DPRK
articles.content:
Papers Slam U.S. Moves for Provoking Nuclear War against DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces invited a U.S. B-1B formation to stage an A-bomb dropping drill simulating a preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					 Meanwhile, the war maniacs of the U.S. and south Korea dragged the Canadian navy, which had been involved in the Korean War as mercenary, into a joint naval drill in the waters around Jeju Island that started on Friday.
					
					 Commenting on the fact, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says:
					
					 This is just another serious military provocation to the DPRK and a risky move to escalate tensions on the Korean peninsula as it is the revelation of the scenario for igniting a war against DPRK.
					
					 The situation shows that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities' talk about "dialogue" is just a sly trick to deceive the DPRK and ignite a war against it.
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK are closely following every move of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces. They are fully ready to deal a merciless annihilating blow at the aggressors once they make a provocation.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean regime should think twice about the catastrophic disaster to be entailed by their reckless provocation.
					
					 Minju Joson's commentary on the same day terms the foolhardy moves of the U.S. imperialists and their vassal forces the revelation of their risky scenario to ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK.

articles.title: Minju Joson Flails U.S. Military Actions in World Hot Spots
articles.content:
Minju Joson Flails U.S. Military Actions in World Hot Spots
Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. secretary of State and secretary of Defense told a news conference that the U.S. is planning to additionally deploy 10,000 troops of the U.S. army and NATO forces to Afghanistan to eliminate terrorists.
					 Meanwhile, the U.S. removed its multi-purpose multiple rocket launchers which had been deployed in Jordan to a military base in south-eastern Syria.
					
					 This is just the revelation of the cunning scheme of the U.S. to further strengthen its military supremacy in the world hot spots, Minju Joson's Sunday commentary says, adding:
					
					 The U.S. provoked wars in some countries such as Afghanistan and Iraq under the pretext of "combating terrorism", but what happened due to them were neither peace nor establishment of democratic order but a vicious cycle of terrorism and revenge.
					
					 That's because the U.S. has not heeded to the "anti-terrorism war" from the outset but been engrossed in materializing its strategy for hegemony.
					
					 The U.S. remains unchanged in its way of securing hegemony.
					
					 The situation underscores the need for the world public to remain vigilant against and categorically reject the U.S. moves for dominating the world masked as "anti-terrorism", "for peace" and "establishment of democratic order".
					
					 History will surely bring the U.S. to justice for the inhuman crimes it committed by plunging the world into the turmoil of dispute, killing and wars and inflicting untold misfortune and pain on mankind.

articles.title: S. Koreans Call for Lifting Sanctions and Blockade on DPRK
articles.content:
S. Koreans Call for Lifting Sanctions and Blockade on DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- The 2017 Forum for Democracy and Peace and the Council of Voters for Building Democratic and Peace-loving "Government" and Great Reform in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on June 22 in demand of lifting sanctions and military blockade on the DPRK.
					 Speakers at the conference said the south Korean people made their stand clear never to accept the increasing danger of war on the Korean peninsula through their candlelight resistance.
					
					 They claimed international sanctions and military blockade on the DPRK only increased the danger and accelerated the north's development of its nuclear capability.

articles.title: U.S. Advised to Draw Lesson from Defeat in Korean War
articles.content:
U.S. Advised to Draw Lesson from Defeat in Korean War
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, issued a statement on June 23 on the lapse of 67 years since the U.S. imperialists ignited a war against the DPRK.
					 The statement said that the last Korean War was a great disaster to the Korean nation and the most unethical challenge as it hindered the independent development of the Korean nation and destroyed the world peace.
					
					 The war clearly showed the world that the U.S. is the mastermind of aggression and wars and the most shameless criminal state which makes no scruple of massacring the people, it said, and went on:
					
					 Far from drawing due lesson from their defeat in the Korean War, the U.S. imperialists have since made all sorts of reckless provocations and staged joint military exercises in south Korea every year, watching for a chance to ignite a second Korean war.
					
					 The U.S. should renounce the hostile policy towards the DPRK and pull out its troops from south Korea at once, clearly mindful that it will be totally ruined in case it ignites another war in Korea.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should no longer resort to such dangerous deeds as putting the life and safety of the nation at the war gambles of the aggressors, acting a shock brigade for the U.S. imperialists' Asia-Pacific strategy, but stop all the military provocations they are staging with the U.S.
					
					 They should come to their senses and courageously take the road of improved north-south relations and peace and reunification of the country, in reliance on the nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Carried by Nepalese Magazine
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Carried by Nepalese Magazine
Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- The May 15-June 15 issue of Nepal's magazine Left Review carried the full text of the New Year Address made by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un with his photo.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was formed by the Moscow Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on June 12.
					 The chief of the group was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize events praising Kim Il Sung's exploits, including a seminar on his work, on the occasion of July 8.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Syria
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Syria
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was formed by the Socialist Unionist Party of Syria on June 18.
					 General Secretary Adnan Ismail was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Il Sung in the period between June 19 and July 9.

articles.title: Significant Days of DPRK Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Significant Days of DPRK Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries to celebrate the 53rd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the first anniversary of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's election as chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK.
					 Meetings, Korean book and photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Romania, Mexico, Norway and India between June 12 and 16.
					
					 The secretary general of the Romanian Workers' Association noted that Kim Jong Il made the WPK demonstrate its dignity as the party of the leader, the mother party which formed a harmonious whole with the popular masses and the guiding force of the Songun revolution.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico said that the WPK had led the struggle for defending the dignity and sovereignty of the country to victory under the guidance of Kim Jong Il, dynamically advancing the cause of socialism without any slightest mistake in its line for many years.
					
					 The chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway said that Kim Jong Un has made eye-opening successes in all fields of the revolution and construction, smashing every challenge of the imperialists with the might of Songun true to the will of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chairman of the Juche Philosophy Study Committee of India said that the WPK headed by Kim Jong Un would always emerge victorious.

articles.title: Eliminados mas de 800 mil explosivos en la RPDC desde la pasada guerra coreana
articles.content:
Eliminados mas de 800 mil explosivos en la RPDC desde la pasada guerra coreana
Pyongyang, 25 de junio (ACNC) -- Las huellas de la guerra desatada hace 67 anos por los imperialistas norteamericanos contra la RPDC, recien fundada entonces, delatan todavia a todo el mundo las atrocidades de esos enemigos jurados del pueblo coreano.
					  En particular, en mas de 60 anos desde la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria (1950-1953), fueron desactivados a lo largo del pais mas de 800 mil artificios explosivos lanzados por el imperialismo agresor yanqui.
					
					  Solo en el nuevo siglo, han sido detectados e inutilizados mas de 200 mil en distintas partes.
					
					  Resultaron desactivadas mas de 58 mil minas durante la roturacion de cientos de hectareas de nuevas tierras cultivables y mas de un millar de hectareas de marisma en la zona de Yonbaek de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.
					
					  Quedaron descubiertos y removidos mas de 2 mil 800 explosivos en los tramos ferroviales del distrito de Unjon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					
					  Se hizo otro tanto con decenas de miles de explosivos en la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur, en particular, una bomba de gran tamano en los alrededores del puente ferroviario en el rio Namchon de la ciudad de Kaechon.
					
					  En septiembre de 2010, causo vehemente indignacion del pueblo la bomba de una tonelada, hallada a 5 metros de profundidad en las aguas del rio Taedong cercanas al capitalino Estadio Primero de Mayo.
					
					  Los miembros del equipo de desactivacion de explosivos de la Direccion de Seguridad del Pueblo de la ciudad de Pyongyang lograron eliminar mas de 70 bombas en los campos de construccion del Complejo de Piscinas de Recreacion de Munsu y el Club de Equitacion de Mirim (en 2012) y 6 bombas de 250 kg cada una y mas de 900 proyectiles de artilleria (en 2014).
					
					  Sus colegas de las Direcciones de Seguridad del Pueblo en las provincias, participantes en la construccion de la base ganadera en la zona de Sepho, removieron mas de 37 mil artefactos dinamiteros, inclusive 3 bombas de 500 kg cada una.
					
					Este ano tambien, se eliminaron en los distritos de Kumgang y Kosong de la provincia de Kangwon mas de 760 explosivos, inclusive 8 bombas de 500kg y 10 de 250kg.
					
					Durante la eliminacion de explosivos, se quitaron mas de 350 mil minas en forma de mariposa, inclusive mas de 5 mil 800 bombas matrices, hecho que confirma las barbaridades de los delincuentes contra la humanidad y los salvajes con la piel humana.
					
					Los miembros de una organizacion no gubernamental de Europa Occidental, quienes han sido testigos presenciales de las minas en forma mariposa hechas en EE.UU., descubiertas hace unos anos en el campo de construccion del reparto de viviendas de cientificos Wisong, se quedaron consternados por el uso masivo de esos artefactos letales durante la guerra coreana de hace mas de 60 anos.
					
					Los abominables explosivos, que siguen descubriendose de siglo en siglo, son pruebas materiales del magnicidio cometido por el imperialismo yanqui, destructor de la paz.
